comments:
While testing the explorer via the M4 explorer testplan, I ran into an exception
with the t2.wsdl file.  To reproduce this problem:
1) Import t2.wsdl into the webContent folder of a module.
2) Run the Web services wizard on this WSDL file to generate a skeleton.  This 
will create another WSDL file called wsdl/port.wsdl
3) Right click on this port.wsdl file and select test with WSDL explorer.
4) Expand the tree and select reportDefect.
5) In the right pane enter some data in the TestCaseID field and select GO.
The server console will display the following error:

- Unable to find config file.  Creating new servlet engine config file: /WEB-
INF/server-config.wsdd
- Tried to invoke method public void wsdl.t2.DefectBindingSkeleton.reportDefect
(schema1.t2_wsdl._TestCaseID,schema1.t2_wsdl._Defect,schema1.t2_wsdl.holders._De
fectHolder,schema1.t2_wsdl.holders._TestCaseIDHolder) throws 
java.rmi.RemoteException,schema4.t2_wsdl.CommentType with arguments 
null,schema1.t2_wsdl.holders._DefectHolder,schema1.t2_wsdl.holders._TestCaseIDHo
lder,null.  The arguments do not match the signature.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: argument type mismatch
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)

(RPCProvider.java:402)

(RPCProvider.java:309)

Either the Explorer is sending bad traffic to Axis, or Axis isn't handling 
correct traffic properly. I suggest trying Axis 1.2 to see if it magically 
clears up the problem. Please investigate for M5.
Thanks - CB.
Changed Version field given new release numbering.

Since this smells like an Apache Axis 1.x problem, deferred, although we should 
try this with Axis 1.2(.1) in the M6 milestone timeframe if possible. Over to 
me to shepherd it for now.

Kathy, please try reproducing this. If it's Axis, please open a report in 
Apache's JIRA system. If it's the Explorer, please reassign to Gil.

Deferring bugs of normal or lower severity out of WTP 1.0 per [1]. Please let 
me know if you think this bug should be reconsidered with a higher severity for 
WTP 1.0.

[1] http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/wtp-dev/msg02831.html
